summary: This bill, the Model Employee Reinstatement for Ill-advised Termination Act (MERIT Act), addresses the reinstatement of probationary Federal employees who were terminated as part of a mass termination within a specific timeframe. It mandates reinstatement, outlines payment compensation based on their previous salary, and specifies procedures for notification, selection, and agency compliance. The bill also includes definitions, reporting requirements, and provisions for determining pay and addressing employment benefits within the context of the reinstatement. It also mandates a report on mass terminations from January 20, 2025 to enactment.
